news_header: Elon Musk predicts a 20-30% increase in Tesla sales next year following better-than-expected performance and a rise in vehicle sales.
news_text: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, anticipates a 20-30% increase in sales for the next year. Tesla's performance from July to September surpassed expectations, attributed to a decision to lower vehicle prices. The company's net sales reached $25.2 billion, up from $23.4 billion the previous year, with earnings per share rising to $0.72. Tesla sold nearly 463,000 vehicles in the quarter, marking a 6.4% increase from the previous year. Following this recovery, Tesla's shares rose in the secondary market.
